title: ggquartz
text: scale_target() adds alternating shape scale filled circle target alternating size scale size circles targets. can also use bluegill_palette added style. plot
code: library(magrittr) library(ggplot2) library(ggquartz)  data.frame(x = rnorm(20), y = rnorm(20), color = factor(c(rep(2:6, 3), rep(1, 5))), z= factor(c(rep(1, 15), rep(2, 5)))) %>%    ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y, shape = z, size = z, color = color)) +    scale_target() +    scale_color_manual(values = bluegill_palette) +     geom_point() -> p  ggsave("./example.png")

what: A palette set to the colors of a bluegill fish — bluegill_palette
title: A palette set to the colors of a bluegill fish — bluegill_palette

title: scale_target — scale_target

title: scale_target — scale_target
code: library(dplyr) #> Error in library(dplyr): there is no package called ‘dplyr’ library(ggplot2) data.frame(x = rnorm(20), y = rnorm(20), z= factor(c(rep(1, 15), rep(2, 5)))) %>%    ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y, shape = z, size = z, color = z)) +    scale_target() +    geom_point() #> Error in data.frame(x = rnorm(20), y = rnorm(20), z = factor(c(rep(1,     15), rep(2, 5)))) %>% ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y, shape = z,     size = z, color = z)): could not find function "%>%"
